meanings.definition: To strive more than someone else in a competition or endeavor.
meanings.sent1: She was outstriving her opponent in the race, pushing herself to run faster.
meanings.sent2: The team was outstriving their rivals to win the championship.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outstriving the birds to reach the top of the tree for the acorns.
meanings.sent4: His determination was outstriving any obstacles in his path to success.
meanings.sent5: The young athlete's outstriving spirit inspired others to work harder.

meanings.definition: The act of striving harder or surpassing others in effort or achievement.
meanings.sent1: Her outstriving in academics earned her the top position in the class.
meanings.sent2: The outstriving of the students in the science fair was evident in their innovative projects.
meanings.sent3: The outstriving of the ants to gather food amused the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The outstriving of the waves crashing against the shore was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The outstriving of the sun to break through the clouds painted a beautiful sky.
